headline: Lost the human touch
status:
24 September 2020
"Lost the human touch"
2.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros: Stability, whatever thats left of it at least.
cons: A few new faces in senior management hired from the private sector. The administration has lost its famed human touch, and went down a path of hostility and belittlement. A shame for the students and academics who deserves a better learning environment.
advice_to_mgmt: Seriously need to dial down the politics and bickering, get off the high horse and start to serve the University community whole-heartedly and genuinely.

headline: Rating for Research Laboratory Workers
status:
18 June 2020
"Rating for Research Laboratory Workers"
2.0
★★★★★
Former Employee
pros: Friendly, dynamic, and resourceful environment with an open-door policy. It is easy to go around and ask people for help even when it comes to borrowing resources such as chemicals.
cons: Lack of state-of-the-art equipment is an absolute downfall of the university. The corridor of the science labs is extremely narrow. Workplace toxicity is rampant, with unfortunately a lot of it comes from the professors themselves, and some colleagues can be very conservative. There are also cases when research ideas can be scooped with few people caring about research ethics. Backstabbing is a common practice there. The "publish or perish" culture is definitely present at the moment (written in 2020)
advice_to_mgmt: Good luck. May God find mercy in our souls

headline: Ideal place to start your PhD study
status:

"Ideal place to start your PhD study"
5.0

Current Employee
pros: All full time PhD students are provided with the standard fellowship in their normal study period. The school also hosts lots of workshops/talks in general topics for you to gain knowledge outside your field.
cons: Limited extra scholarships for research postgraduates. There are many of them for undergraduates.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep investing in STEM to grow the scientific research facilities and community.

headline: positive experience
pros:
Positive collegial work environment. (But of course this would vary from team to team, so it really depends on who your direct supervisor and colleagues are.)
Nice views from the office, interesting talks and seminars throughout the year, employees can access the gym for free, nice newly renovated swimming pool which employees can access for a small fee.
cons:
The walk from/to the MTR station was very uncomfortable. I often took the mini bus from Kowloon Tong Station in the mornings to avoid being soaked in sweat when I arrive, but that costed a lot.
Not many decent dining options nearby.
